String.Name: DeviceVendorName
String.ToolTip: Name of the manufacturer of the device.
String.Description: Name of the manufacturer of the device.

String.Name: DeviceFirmwareVersion
String.ToolTip: Version of the firmware in the device.
String.Description: Version of the firmware in the device.

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionMajor
Integer.ToolTip: Major Version of the Standard Feature Naming Convention that was used to create the device`s XML.
Integer.Description: Major Version of the Standard Feature Naming Convention that was used to create the device`s XML.

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionMinor
Integer.ToolTip: Minor Version of the Standard Feature Naming Convention that was used to create the device`s XML.
Integer.Description: Minor Version of the Standard Feature Naming Convention that was used to create the device`s XML

Integer.Name: DeviceSFNCVersionSubMinor
Integer.ToolTip: Sub Minor Version of Standard Feature Naming Convention that was used to create the device`s XML.
Integer.Description: Sub Minor Version of Standard Feature Naming Convention that was used to create the device`s XML.

Integer.Name: DeviceManifestEntrySelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the manifest entry to reference.
Integer.Description: Selects the manifest entry to reference.

Integer.Name: DeviceManifestXMLMajorVersion
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the major version number of the XML file of the selected manifest entry.
Integer.Description: Indicates the major version number of the XML file of the selected manifest entry.

Integer.Name: DeviceManifestXMLMinorVersion
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the minor version number of the XML file of the selected manifest entry.
Integer.Description: Indicates the minor version number of the XML file of the selected manifest entry.

Integer.Name: DeviceManifestXMLSubMinorVersion

Integer.Name: DeviceManifestSchemaMajorVersion
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the major version number of the schema file of the selected manifest entry.
Integer.Description: Indicates the major version number of the schema file of the selected manifest entry.

Integer.Name: DeviceManifestSchemaMinorVersion
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the minor version number of the schema file of the selected manifest entry.
Integer.Description: Indicates the minor version number of the schema file of the selected manifest entry.

String.Name: DeviceManifestPrimaryURL
String.ToolTip: Indicates the first URL to the XML device description file of the selected manifest entry.
String.Description: Indicates the first URL to the XML device description file of the selected manifest entry.

String.Name: DeviceManifestSecondaryURL
String.ToolTip: Indicates the second URL to the XML device description file of the selected manifest entry.
String.Description: Indicates the second URL to the XML device description file of the selected manifest entry.

Command.Name: DeviceReset
Command.ToolTip: Resets the device to its power up state.
Command.Description: Resets the device to its power up state.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersStreamingStart
Command.ToolTip: Prepare the device for registers streaming without checking for consistency.
Command.Description: Prepare the device for registers streaming without checking for consistency.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersStreamingEnd
Command.ToolTip: Announce the end of registers streaming.
Command.Description: Announce the end of registers streaming. This will do a register set validation for consistency and activate it. This will also update the DeviceRegistersValid flag.

Command.Name: DeviceRegistersCheck
Command.ToolTip: Perform the validation of the current register set for consistency.
Command.Description: Perform the validation of the current register set for consistency. This will update the DeviceRegistersValid flag.

Boolean.Name: DeviceRegistersValid
Boolean.ToolTip: Returns if the current register set is valid and consistent.
Boolean.Description: Returns if the current register set is valid and consistent.

Integer.Name: DeviceMaxThroughput
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum bandwidth of the data that can be streamed out of the device.
Integer.Description: Maximum bandwidth of the data that can be streamed out of the device. This can be used to estimate if the network connection can sustain transfer of free-running images from the camera at its maximum speed.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceTemperatureSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the location within the device, where the temperature will be measured.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the location within the device, where the temperature will be measured.

Float.Name: DeviceTemperature
Float.Description: Device temperature in degrees Celsius (C). It is measured at the location selected by DeviceTemperatureSelector.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceClockSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the clock frequency to access from the device.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the clock frequency to access from the device.

EnumEntry.Name: Sensor
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Clock frequency of the image sensor of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: Clock frequency of the image sensor of the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: SensorDigitization
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Clock frequency of the camera A/D conversion stage.
EnumEntry.Description: Clock frequency of the camera A/D conversion stage.

EnumEntry.Name: CameraLink
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Speed of the Camera Link clock.
EnumEntry.Description: Speed of the Camera Link clock.

Float.Name: DeviceClockFrequency
Float.ToolTip: Returns the frequency in Hertz of the selected Clock.
Float.Description: Returns the frequency in Hertz of the selected Clock.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceSerialPortSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which device serial port to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which device serial port to control.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceSerialPortBaudRate
Enumeration.ToolTip: This feature controls the baud rate used by the selected device's serial port.
Enumeration.Description: This feature controls the baud rate used by the selected device's serial port. Typical values listed should be used whenever possible. Arbitrary values can also be used by defining new enumeration entries.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceScanType
Enumeration.ToolTip: Scan type of the sensor of the device.
Enumeration.Description: Scan type of the sensor of the device.

EnumEntry.Name: Areascan
EnumEntry.ToolTip: 2D sensor
EnumEntry.Description: 2D sensor

EnumEntry.Name: Linescan
EnumEntry.ToolTip: 1D sensor
EnumEntry.Description: 1D sensor

Integer.Name: SensorWidth
Integer.ToolTip: Effective width of the sensor in pixels.
Integer.Description: Effective width of the sensor in pixels.

Integer.Name: SensorHeight
Integer.ToolTip: Effective height of the sensor in pixels.
Integer.Description: Effective height of the sensor in pixels.

Enumeration.Name: SensorTaps
Enumeration.ToolTip: Number of taps of the camera sensor.
Enumeration.Description: Number of taps of the camera sensor.

Enumeration.Name: SensorDigitizationTaps
Enumeration.ToolTip: Number of digitized samples outputted simultaneously by the camera A/D conversion stage.
Enumeration.Description: Number of digitized samples outputted simultaneously by the camera A/D conversion stage.

Integer.Name: WidthMax
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum width (in pixels) of the image.
Integer.Description: Maximum width (in pixels) of the image. The dimension is calculated after horizontal binning, decimation or any other function changing the horizontal dimension of the image.

Integer.Name: HeightMax
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum height (in pixels) of the image.
Integer.Description: Maximum height (in pixels) of the image. This dimension is calculated after vertical binning, decimation or any other function changing the vertical dimension of the image.

Integer.Name: Width
Integer.ToolTip: Width of the Image provided by the device (in pixels).
Integer.Description: Width of the Image provided by the device (in pixels).

Integer.Name: Height
Integer.ToolTip: Height of the image provided by the device (in pixels).
Integer.Description: Height of the image provided by the device (in pixels).

Integer.Name: OffsetX
Integer.ToolTip: Horizontal offset from the origin to the area of interest (in pixels).
Integer.Description: Horizontal offset from the origin to the area of interest (in pixels).

Integer.Name: OffsetY
Integer.ToolTip: Vertical offset from the origin to the area of interest (in pixels).
Integer.Description: Vertical offset from the origin to the area of interest (in pixels).

Integer.Name: LinePitch
Integer.ToolTip: Total number of bytes between 2 successive lines.
Integer.Description: Total number of bytes between 2 successive lines. This feature is used to facilitate alignment of image data.

Integer.Name: BinningHorizontal
Integer.ToolTip: Number of horizontal photo-sensitive cells to combine together.
Integer.Description: Number of horizontal photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity (or signal to noise ratio) of the pixels and reduces the horizontal resolution (width) of the image.

Integer.Name: BinningVertical
Integer.ToolTip: Number of vertical photo-sensitive cells to combine together.
Integer.Description: Number of vertical photo-sensitive cells to combine together. This increases the intensity (or signal to noise ratio) of the pixels and reduces the vertical resolution (height) of the image.

Integer.Name: DecimationHorizontal
Integer.ToolTip: Horizontal sub-sampling of the image.
Integer.Description: Horizontal sub-sampling of the image. This reduces the horizontal resolution (width) of the image by the specified horizontal decimation factor.

Integer.Name: DecimationVertical
Integer.ToolTip: Vertical sub-sampling of the image.
Integer.Description: Vertical sub-sampling of the image. This has the net effect of reducing the vertical resolution (height) of the image by the specified vertical decimation factor.

Boolean.Name: ReverseX
Boolean.ToolTip: Flip horizontally the image sent by the device.
Boolean.Description: Flip horizontally the image sent by the device. The AOI is applied after the flipping.

Boolean.Name: ReverseY
Boolean.ToolTip: Flip vertically the image sent by the device.
Boolean.Description: Flip vertically the image sent by the device. The AOI is applied after the flipping.

Enumeration.Name: PixelFormat
Enumeration.ToolTip: Format of the pixel provided by the device.
Enumeration.Description: Format of the pixel provided by the device. It represents all the informations provided by PixelCoding, PixelSize, PixelColorFilter but combined in one single value.

Enumeration.Name: PixelCoding
Enumeration.ToolTip: Coding of the pixels in the image.
Enumeration.Description: Coding of the pixels in the image. Raw gives the data in the native format of the sensor.

Enumeration.Name: PixelSize
Enumeration.ToolTip: Total size in bits of a pixel of the image.
Enumeration.Description: Total size in bits of a pixel of the image.

Enumeration.Name: PixelColorFilter
Enumeration.ToolTip: Type of color filter that is applied to the image.
Enumeration.Description: Type of color filter that is applied to the image.

Integer.Name: PixelDynamicRangeMin
Integer.ToolTip: Minimum value that can be returned during the digitization process.
Integer.Description: Minimum value that can be returned during the digitization process. This corresponds to the darkest value of the camera. For color camera, this returns the smallest value that each color component can take.

Integer.Name: PixelDynamicRangeMax
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum value that will be returned during the digitization process.
Integer.Description: Maximum value that will be returned during the digitization process. This corresponds to the brightest value of the camera. For color camera, this returns the biggest value that each color component can take.

Enumeration.Name: TestImageSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of test image that is sent by the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is coming from the sensor.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is coming from the sensor.

EnumEntry.Name: Black
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is filled with the darkest possible image.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled with the darkest possible image.

EnumEntry.Name: White
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is filled with the brightest possible image.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled with the brightest possible image.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyHorizontalRamp
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyVerticalRamp
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is filled vertically with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled vertically with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyHorizontalRampMoving
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest and that moves horizontally from left to right at each frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled horizontally with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest and that moves horizontally from left to right at each frame.

EnumEntry.Name: GreyVerticalRampMoving
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is filled vertically with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest and that moves verticaly from top to bottom at each frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled vertically with an image that goes from the darkest possible value to the brightest and that moves verticaly from top to bottom at each frame.

EnumEntry.Name: VerticalLineMoving
EnumEntry.ToolTip: A moving vertical line is superimposed on the live image.
EnumEntry.Description: A moving vertical line is superimposed on the live image.

EnumEntry.Name: ColorBar
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Image is filled with stripes of color including White, Black, Red, Green, Blue, Cyan, Magenta and Yellow.
EnumEntry.Description: Image is filled with stripes of color including White, Black, Red, Green, Blue, Cyan, Magenta and Yellow.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameCounter
EnumEntry.ToolTip: A frame counter is superimposed on the live image.
EnumEntry.Description: A frame counter is superimposed on the live image.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the acquisition mode of the device.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the acquisition mode of the device. It defines mainly the number of frames to capture during an acquisition and the way the acquisition stops.

EnumEntry.Name: SingleFrame
EnumEntry.ToolTip: One frame is captured.
EnumEntry.Description: One frame is captured.

EnumEntry.Name: MultiFrame
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The number of frames specified by AcquisitionFrameCount is captured.
EnumEntry.Description: The number of frames specified by AcquisitionFrameCount is captured.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Frames are captured continuously until stopped with the AcquisitionStop command.
EnumEntry.Description: Frames are captured continuously until stopped with the AcquisitionStop command.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStart
Command.ToolTip: Starts the Acquisition of the device.
Command.Description: Starts the Acquisition of the device. The number of frames captured is specified by AcquisitionMode.

Command.Name: AcquisitionStop
Command.ToolTip: Stops the Acquisition of the device at the end of the current Frame.
Command.Description: Stops the Acquisition of the device at the end of the current Frame. It is mainly used when AcquisitionMode is Continuous but can be used in any acquisition mode.

Command.Name: AcquisitionAbort
Command.Description: Aborts the acquisition immediately. This will end the capture without completing the current Frame or waiting on a trigger. If no Acquisition is in progress, the command is ignored.

Command.Name: AcquisitionArm
Command.ToolTip: Arms the device before an AcquisitionStart command.
Command.Description: Arms the device before an AcquisitionStart command. This optional command validates all the current features for consistency and prepares the device for a fast start of the Acquisition.

Integer.Name: AcquisitionFrameCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of frames to acquire in MultiFrame Acquisition mode.
Integer.Description: Number of frames to acquire in MultiFrame Acquisition mode.

Float.Name: AcquisitionFrameRate
Float.ToolTip: Controls the acquisition rate (in Hertz) at which the frames are captured.
Float.Description: Controls the acquisition rate (in Hertz) at which the frames are captured.

Float.Name: AcquisitionLineRate
Float.ToolTip: Controls the rate (in Hertz) at which the Lines in a Frame are captured.
Float.Description: Controls the rate (in Hertz) at which the Lines in a Frame are captured.

Enumeration.Name: AcquisitionStatusSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the internal acquisition signal to read using AcquisitionStatus.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the internal acquisition signal to read using AcquisitionStatus.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionTriggerWait
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device is currently waiting for a trigger for the capture of one or many frames.
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently waiting for a trigger for the capture of one or many frames.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device is currently doing an acquisition of one or many frames.
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently doing an acquisition of one or many frames.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionTransfer
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device is currently transferring an acquisition of one or many frames.
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently transferring an acquisition of one or many frames.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameTriggerWait
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device is currently waiting for a Frame trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently waiting for a Frame trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device is currently doing the capture of a frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently doing the capture of a frame.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameTransfer
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device is currently transferring a frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Device is currently transferring a frame.

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Device is doing the Exposure of a frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Device is doing the Exposure of a frame.

Boolean.Name: AcquisitionStatus
Boolean.ToolTip: Reads the state of the internal acquisition signal selected using AcquisitionStatusSelector.
Boolean.Description: Reads the state of the internal acquisition signal selected using AcquisitionStatusSelector.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the type of trigger to configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the type of trigger to configure.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger that starts the Acquisition of one or many frames according to AcquisitionMode.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger that starts the Acquisition of one or many frames according to AcquisitionMode.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger that ends the Acquisition of one or many frames according to AcquisitionMode.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger that ends the Acquisition of one or many frames according to AcquisitionMode.

EnumEntry.Name: AcquisitionActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger that controls the duration of the Acquisition of one or many frames. The Acquisition is activated when the trigger signal becomes active and terminated when it goes back to the inactive state.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger that controls the duration of the Acquisition of one or many frames. The Acquisition is activated when the trigger signal becomes active and terminated when it goes back to the inactive state.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger starting the capture of one frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger starting the capture of one frame.

EnumEntry.Name: FrameEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger ending the capture of one frame (mainly used in line scan mode).
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger ending the capture of one frame (mainly used in line scan mode).

EnumEntry.Name: FrameActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger controlling the duration of one frame (mainly used in line scan mode).
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger controlling the duration of one frame (mainly used in line scan mode).

EnumEntry.Name: LineStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger starting the capture of one Line of a Frame (mainly used in line scan mode).
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger starting the capture of one Line of a Frame (mainly used in line scan mode).

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger controlling the start of the exposure of one Frame (or Line).
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger controlling the start of the exposure of one Frame (or Line).

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureEnd
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger controlling the end of the exposure of one Frame (or Line).
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger controlling the end of the exposure of one Frame (or Line).

EnumEntry.Name: ExposureActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects a trigger controlling the duration of the exposure of one frame (or Line).
EnumEntry.Description: Selects a trigger controlling the duration of the exposure of one frame (or Line).

Enumeration.Name: TriggerMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls if the selected trigger is active.
Enumeration.Description: Controls if the selected trigger is active.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Disables the selected trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Disables the selected trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: On
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Enable the selected trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Enable the selected trigger.

Command.Name: TriggerSoftware
Command.Description: Generates an internal trigger. TriggerSource must be set to Software.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerSource
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the internal signal or physical input Line to use as the trigger source.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the internal signal or physical input Line to use as the trigger source. The selected trigger must have its TriggerMode set to On.

EnumEntry.Name: Software
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger source will be generated by software using the TriggerSoftware command.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger source will be generated by software using the TriggerSoftware command.

EnumEntry.Name: Line1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Line2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the trigger signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which physical line (or pin) and associated I/O control block to use as external source for the trigger signal.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer1End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which Timer signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter2Start
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter1End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Counter2End
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which of the Counter signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: UserOutput0
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which User Output bit signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which User Output bit signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: UserOutput1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which User Output bit signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which User Output bit signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: UserOutput2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which User Output bit signal to use as internal source for the trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies which User Output bit signal to use as internal source for the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: Action2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies which Action command to use as internal source for the trigger.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerActivation
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the activation mode of the trigger.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the activation mode of the trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: RisingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the rising edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: FallingEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: AnyEdge
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling or rising edge of the source signal.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid on the falling or rising edge of the source signal.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelHigh
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is high.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is high.

EnumEntry.Name: LevelLow
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is low.
EnumEntry.Description: Specifies that the trigger is considered valid as long as the level of the source signal is low.

Enumeration.Name: TriggerOverlap
Enumeration.ToolTip: Specifies the type trigger overlap permitted with the previous frame.
Enumeration.Description: Specifies the type trigger overlap permitted with the previous frame. This defines when a valid trigger will be accepted (or latched) for a new frame.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: No trigger overlap is permitted.
EnumEntry.Description: No trigger overlap is permitted.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadOut
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Trigger is accepted immediately after the exposure period.
EnumEntry.Description: Trigger is accepted immediately after the exposure period.

EnumEntry.Name: PreviousFrame
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Trigger is accepted (latched) at any time during the capture of the previous frame.
EnumEntry.Description: Trigger is accepted (latched) at any time during the capture of the previous frame.

Float.Name: TriggerDelay
Float.ToolTip: Specifies the delay in microseconds (us) to apply after the trigger reception before activating it.
Float.Description: Specifies the delay in microseconds (us) to apply after the trigger reception before activating it.

Integer.Name: TriggerDivider
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies a division factor for the incoming trigger pulses.
Integer.Description: Specifies a division factor for the incoming trigger pulses.

Integer.Name: TriggerMultiplier
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies a multiplication factor for the incoming trigger pulses.
Integer.Description: Specifies a multiplication factor for the incoming trigger pulses. It is used generally used in conjunction with TriggerDivider to control the ratio of triggers that are accepted.

Enumeration.Name: ExposureMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the operation mode of the Exposure (or shutter).
Enumeration.Description: Sets the operation mode of the Exposure (or shutter).

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Disables the Exposure and let the shutter open.
EnumEntry.Description: Disables the Exposure and let the shutter open.

EnumEntry.Name: Timed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Timed exposure. The exposure duration time is set using the ExposureTime or ExposureAuto features and the exposure starts with the FrameStart (see Figure 52).
EnumEntry.Description: Timed exposure. The exposure duration time is set using the ExposureTime or ExposureAuto features and the exposure starts with the FrameStart (see Figure 52).

EnumEntry.Name: TriggerWidth
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Uses the width of the current Frame or Line trigger signal(s) pulse to control the exposure duration. Note that if the Frame or Line TriggerActivation is RisingEdge or LevelHigh, the exposure duration will be the time the trigger stays High. If TriggerActivation is FallingEdge or LevelLow, the exposure time will last as long as the trigger stays Low.
EnumEntry.Description: Uses the width of the current Frame or Line trigger signal(s) pulse to control the exposure duration. Note that if the Frame or Line TriggerActivation is RisingEdge or LevelHigh, the exposure duration will be the time the trigger stays High. If TriggerActivation is FallingEdge or LevelLow, the exposure time will last as long as the trigger stays Low.

EnumEntry.Name: TriggerControlled
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Uses one or more trigger signal(s) to control the exposure duration independently from the current Frame or Line triggers. See ExposureStart, ExposureEnd and ExposureActive of the TriggerSelector feature.
EnumEntry.Description: Uses one or more trigger signal(s) to control the exposure duration independently from the current Frame or Line triggers. See ExposureStart, ExposureEnd and ExposureActive of the TriggerSelector feature.

Float.Name: ExposureTime
Float.ToolTip: Sets the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed.
Float.Description: Sets the Exposure time (in microseconds) when ExposureMode is Timed. This controls the duration where the photosensitive cells are exposed to light.

Enumeration.Name: ExposureAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the automatic exposure mode when ExposureMode is Timed.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the automatic exposure mode when ExposureMode is Timed. The exact algorithm used to implement this control is device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Exposure duration is manually controlled using ExposureTime.
EnumEntry.Description: Exposure duration is manually controlled using ExposureTime.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Exposure duration is adapted once by the device. Once it has converged, it returns to the Off state.
EnumEntry.Description: Exposure duration is adapted once by the device. Once it has converged, it returns to the Off state.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Exposure duration is constantly adapted by the device to maximize the dynamic range.
EnumEntry.Description: Exposure duration is constantly adapted by the device to maximize the dynamic range.

If the UserOutputValueAllMask feature is present, setting the user Output register using UserOutputValueAll will only change the bits that have a corresponding bit in the mask set to one.

EnumEntry.Name: Timer2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the second Timer.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the second Timer.

Float.Name: TimerDuration
Float.ToolTip: Sets the duration (in microseconds) of the Timer pulse.
Float.Description: Sets the duration (in microseconds) of the Timer pulse.

Float.Name: TimerDelay
Float.ToolTip: Sets the duration (in microseconds) of the delay to apply at the reception of a trigger before to start the Timer.
Float.Description: Sets the duration (in microseconds) of the delay to apply at the reception of a trigger before to start the Timer.

Command.Name: TimerReset
Command.ToolTip: Does a software reset of the selected timer and starts it.
Command.Description: Does a software reset of the selected timer and starts it. The timer starts counting events immediately after the reset unless a timer trigger is active.

Float.Name: TimerValue
Float.ToolTip: Reads or writes the current value (in microseconds) of the selected Timer.
Float.Description: Reads or writes the current value (in microseconds) of the selected Timer.

Enumeration.Name: TimerStatus
Enumeration.ToolTip: Returns the current state of the Timer.
Enumeration.Description: Returns the current state of the Timer.

EnumEntry.Description: The Timer is idle. TimerTriggerSource is Off.

EnumEntry.Name: TimerTriggerWait
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Timer is waiting for a start trigger.
EnumEntry.Description: The Timer is waiting for a start trigger.

EnumEntry.Name: TimerActive
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Timer is counting for the specified duration.
EnumEntry.Description: The Timer is counting for the specified duration.

EnumEntry.Name: TimerCompleted

EnumEntry.Description: The Timer reached the TimerDuration count.

Enumeration.Name: GainSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Gain is controlled by the various Gain features.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Gain is controlled by the various Gain features.

EnumEntry.Name: All
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to all channels or taps.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to all channels or taps.

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the red channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the red channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Green
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the green channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the green channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Blue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to the blue channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to the blue channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Y
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to Y channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to Y channel.

EnumEntry.Name: U
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to U channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to U channel.

EnumEntry.Name: V
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain will be applied to V channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain will be applied to V channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Tap1

Float.Name: Gain
Float.ToolTip: Controls the selected gain as an absolute physical value.
Float.Description: Controls the selected gain as an absolute physical value. This is an amplification factor applied to the video signal.

Enumeration.Name: GainAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the automatic gain control (AGC) mode.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the automatic gain control (AGC) mode. The exact algorithm used to implement AGC is device-specific.

EnumEntry.Name: Off
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain is manually controlled using Gain.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain is manually controlled using Gain.

EnumEntry.Name: Once
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain is automatically adjusted once by the device. Once it has converged, it automatically returns to the Off state.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain is automatically adjusted once by the device. Once it has converged, it automatically returns to the Off state.

EnumEntry.Name: Continuous
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain is constantly adjusted by the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Gain is constantly adjusted by the device.

Enumeration.ToolTip: Sets the mode for automatic gain balancing between the sensor color channels or taps.
Enumeration.Description: Sets the mode for automatic gain balancing between the sensor color channels or taps. The gain coefficients of each channel or tap are adjusted so they are matched.

EnumEntry.ToolTip: Gain tap balancing is manually controlled using Gain .
EnumEntry.Description: Gain tap balancing is manually controlled using Gain .

Enumeration.Description: Controls the mode for automatic black level adjustment. The exact algorithm used to implement this adjustment is device-specific.

EnumEntry.Description: Analog black level is manually controlled using BlackLevel.

Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the mode for automatic black level balancing between the sensor color channels or taps.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the mode for automatic black level balancing between the sensor color channels or taps. The black level coefficients of each channel are adjusted so they are matched.

EnumEntry.Description: Black level tap balancing is manually controlled using BlackLevel.

Float.Name: WhiteClip
Float.ToolTip: Controls the maximal intensity taken by the video signal before being clipped as an absolute physical value.
Float.Description: Controls the maximal intensity taken by the video signal before being clipped as an absolute physical value. The video signal will never exceed the white clipping point: it will saturate at that level.

Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Balance ratio to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Balance ratio to control.

EnumEntry.Name: Red
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Balance Ratio will be applied to the red channel.
EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to the red channel.

EnumEntry.Name: Green

EnumEntry.Description: Balance Ratio will be applied to the green channel.

Float.Name: BalanceRatio
Float.ToolTip: Controls ratio of the selected color component to a reference color component.
Float.Description: Controls ratio of the selected color component to a reference color component. It is used for white balancing.

Enumeration.Name: BalanceWhiteAuto
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the mode for automatic white balancing between the color channels.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the mode for automatic white balancing between the color channels. The white balancing ratios are automatically adjusted.

EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is manually controlled using BalanceRatioSelector and BalanceRatio.

EnumEntry.Description: White balancing is constantly adjusted by the device.

Float.Name: Gamma
Float.ToolTip: Controls the gamma correction of pixel intensity.
Float.Description: Controls the gamma correction of pixel intensity. This is typically used to compensate for non-linearity of the display system (such as CRT).

Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which LUT to control.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which LUT to control.

Boolean.Description: Activates the selected LUT.

Integer.Description: Control the index (offset) of the coefficient to access in the selected LUT.

Integer.Name: LUTValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the Value at entry LUTIndex of the LUT selected by LUTSelector.
Integer.Description: Returns the Value at entry LUTIndex of the LUT selected by LUTSelector.

Register.Name: LUTValueAll
Register.ToolTip: Accesses all the LUT coefficients in a single access without using individual LUTIndex.
Register.Description: Accesses all the LUT coefficients in a single access without using individual LUTIndex.

Integer.Name: PayloadSize
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the number of bytes transferred for each image or chunk on the stream channel.
Integer.Description: Provides the number of bytes transferred for each image or chunk on the stream channel. This includes any end-of-line, end-of-frame statistics or other stamp data. This is the total size of data payload for a data block.

Integer.ToolTip: Major version of the specification.
Integer.Description: Major version of the specification.

Integer.Name: GevVersionMinor

Integer.Description: Reports the subnet mask of the given interface.

Integer.ToolTip: Reports the default gateway IP address to be used on the given network interface.
Integer.Description: Reports the default gateway IP address to be used on the given network interface.

Enumeration.Name: GevIPConfigurationStatus
Enumeration.ToolTip: Reports the current IP configuration status.
Enumeration.Description: Reports the current IP configuration status.

String.Name: GevFirstURL
String.ToolTip: Indicates the first URL to the XML device description file.
String.Description: Indicates the first URL to the XML device description file. The First URL is used as the first choice by the application to retrieve the XML device description file.

String.Name: GevSecondURL
String.ToolTip: Indicates the second URL to the XML device description file.
String.Description: Indicates the second URL to the XML device description file. This URL is an alternative if the application was unsuccessful to retrieve the device description file using the first URL.

Integer.Name: GevNumberOfInterfaces
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of physical network interfaces supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of physical network interfaces supported by this device.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentIPAddress
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the Persistent IP address for this network interface.
Integer.Description: Controls the Persistent IP address for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentSubnetMask
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the Persistent subnet mask associated with the Persistent IP address on this network interface.
Integer.Description: Controls the Persistent subnet mask associated with the Persistent IP address on this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevPersistentDefaultGateway
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the persistent default gateway for this network interface.
Integer.Description: Controls the persistent default gateway for this network interface. It is only used when the device boots with the Persistent IP configuration scheme.

Integer.Name: GevLinkSpeed
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the speed of transmission negotiated by the given network interface.
Integer.Description: Indicates the speed of transmission negotiated by the given network interface.

Integer.Name: GevMessageChannelCount
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of message channels supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of message channels supported by this device.

Integer.Name: GevStreamChannelCount
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device.
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of stream channels supported by this device.

Integer.Name: GevHeartbeatTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the current heartbeat timeout in milliseconds.
Integer.Description: Controls the current heartbeat timeout in milliseconds.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampTickFrequency
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the number of timestamp ticks in 1 second (frequency in Hz).
Integer.Description: Indicates the number of timestamp ticks in 1 second (frequency in Hz).

Command.Name: GevTimestampControlLatch
Command.ToolTip: Latches the current timestamp counter into GevTimestampValue.
Command.Description: Latches the current timestamp counter into GevTimestampValue.

Integer.Name: GevTimestampValue
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the latched 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.
Integer.Description: Returns the latched 64-bit value of the timestamp counter.

Integer.Name: GevDiscoveryAckDelay
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the maximum randomized delay the device will wait to acknowledge a discovery command.
Integer.Description: Indicates the maximum randomized delay the device will wait to acknowledge a discovery command.

Boolean.Name: GevGVCPExtendedStatusCodes
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the generation of extended status codes.
Boolean.Description: Enables the generation of extended status codes.

Boolean.Name: GevGVCPPendingAck
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the generation of PENDING_ACK.
Boolean.Description: Enables the generation of PENDING_ACK.

Boolean.Name: GevGVCPHeartbeatDisable
Boolean.ToolTip: Disables the GVCP heartbeat.
Boolean.Description: Disables the GVCP heartbeat.

Integer.Name: GevGVCPPendingTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the longest GVCP command execution time before a device returns a PENDING_ACK.
Integer.Description: Indicates the longest GVCP command execution time before a device returns a PENDING_ACK.

Integer.Name: GevPrimaryApplicationSwitchoverKey
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the key to use to authenticate primary application switchover requests.
Integer.Description: Controls the key to use to authenticate primary application switchover requests.

Enumeration.Name: GevCCP
Enumeration.ToolTip: Controls the device access privilege of an application.
Enumeration.Description: Controls the device access privilege of an application.

Integer.Name: GevPrimaryApplicationSocket
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the UDP source port of the primary application.
Integer.Description: Returns the UDP source port of the primary application.

Integer.Name: GevPrimaryApplicationIPAddress
Integer.ToolTip: Returns the address of the primary application.
Integer.Description: Returns the address of the primary application.

Integer.Name: GevMCPHostPort
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the port to which the device must send messages.
Integer.Description: Controls the port to which the device must send messages. Setting this value to 0 closes the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevMCDA
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the destination IP address for the message channel.
Integer.Description: Controls the destination IP address for the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevMCTT
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the transmission timeout value in milliseconds.
Integer.Description: Provides the transmission timeout value in milliseconds.

Integer.Name: GevMCRC
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the number of retransmissions allowed when a message channel message times out.
Integer.Description: Controls the number of retransmissions allowed when a message channel message times out.

Integer.Name: GevMCSP
Integer.ToolTip: This feature indicates the source port for the message channel.
Integer.Description: This feature indicates the source port for the message channel.

Integer.Name: GevStreamChannelSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects the stream channel to control.
Integer.Description: Selects the stream channel to control.

Boolean.Name: GevSCCFGUnconditionalStreaming
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables the camera to continue to stream, for this stream channel, if its control channel is closed or regardless of the reception of any ICMP messages (such as destination unreachable messages).
Boolean.Description: Enables the camera to continue to stream, for this stream channel, if its control channel is closed or regardless of the reception of any ICMP messages (such as destination unreachable messages).

Boolean.Name: GevSCCFGExtendedChunkData
Boolean.ToolTip: Enables cameras to use the extended chunk data payload type for this stream channel.
Boolean.Description: Enables cameras to use the extended chunk data payload type for this stream channel.

Enumeration.Name: GevSCPDirection
Enumeration.ToolTip: Reports the direction of the stream channel.
Enumeration.Description: Reports the direction of the stream channel.

Integer.Name: GevSCPInterfaceIndex
Integer.ToolTip: Index of network interface to use.
Integer.Description: Index of network interface to use.

Integer.Name: GevSCPHostPort
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the port of the selected channel to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the port from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream.
Integer.Description: Controls the port of the selected channel to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the port from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream. Setting this value to 0 closes the stream channel.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSFireTestPacket
Boolean.ToolTip: Sends a test packet.
Boolean.Description: Sends a test packet. When this feature is set, the device will fire one test packet.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSDoNotFragment
Boolean.ToolTip: The state of this feature is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet.
Boolean.Description: The state of this feature is copied into the "do not fragment" bit of IP header of each stream packet. It can be used by the application to prevent IP fragmentation of packets on the stream channel.

Boolean.Name: GevSCPSBigEndian
Boolean.ToolTip: Endianess of multi-byte pixel data for this stream.
Boolean.Description: Endianess of multi-byte pixel data for this stream.

Integer.Name: GevSCPSPacketSize
Integer.ToolTip: Specifies the stream packet size, in bytes, to send on the selected channel for a GVSP transmitter or specifies the maximum packet size supported by a GVSP receiver.
Integer.Description: Specifies the stream packet size, in bytes, to send on the selected channel for a GVSP transmitter or specifies the maximum packet size supported by a GVSP receiver.

Integer.Name: GevSCPD
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel.
Integer.Description: Controls the delay (in timestamp counter unit) to insert between each packet for this stream channel. This can be used as a crude flow-control mechanism if the application or the network infrastructure cannot keep up with the packets coming from the device.

Integer.Name: GevSCDA
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the destination IP address of the selected stream channel to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the destination IP address from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream.
Integer.Description: Controls the destination IP address of the selected stream channel to which a GVSP transmitter must send data stream or the destination IP address from which a GVSP receiver may receive data stream.

Integer.Name: GevSCSP
Integer.ToolTip: Indicates the source port of the stream channel.
Integer.Description: Indicates the source port of the stream channel.

Enumeration.Name: ClConfiguration
Enumeration.ToolTip: This Camera Link specific feature describes the configuration used by the camera.
Enumeration.Description: This Camera Link specific feature describes the configuration used by the camera. It helps especially when a camera is capable of operation in a non-standard configuration, and when the features PixelSize, SensorDigitizationTaps, and DeviceTapGeometry do not provide enough information for interpretation of the image data provided by the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: Base
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Standard base configuration described by the Camera Link standard.
EnumEntry.Description: Standard base configuration described by the Camera Link standard.

EnumEntry.Name: Medium
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Standard medium configuration described by the Camera Link standard.
EnumEntry.Description: Standard medium configuration described by the Camera Link standard.

EnumEntry.Name: Full
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Standard full configuration described by the Camera Link standard.
EnumEntry.Description: Standard full configuration described by the Camera Link standard.

EnumEntry.Name: DualBase
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The camera streams the data from multiple taps (that do not fit in the standard base configuration) through two Camera Link base ports. It is responsibility of the application or frame grabber to reconstruct the full image. Only one of the ports (fixed) serves as the "master" for serial communication and triggering.
EnumEntry.Description: The camera streams the data from multiple taps (that do not fit in the standard base configuration) through two Camera Link base ports. It is responsibility of the application or frame grabber to reconstruct the full image. Only one of the ports (fixed) serves as the "master" for serial communication and triggering.

EnumEntry.Name: Deca
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Standard Deca configuration with 10 taps of 8-bit, as described by the Camera Link Standard.
EnumEntry.Description: Standard Deca configuration with 10 taps of 8-bit, as described by the Camera Link Standard.

Enumeration.Name: ClTimeSlotsCount
Enumeration.ToolTip: This Camera Link specific feature describes the time multiplexing of the camera link connection to transfer more than the configuration allows, in one single clock.
Enumeration.Description: This Camera Link specific feature describes the time multiplexing of the camera link connection to transfer more than the configuration allows, in one single clock.

Enumeration.Name: DeviceTapGeometry
Enumeration.ToolTip: This Camera Link specific device tap geometry feature describes the geometrical properties characterizing the taps of a Camera Link camera as seen from the frame grabber or acquisition card.
Enumeration.Description: This Camera Link specific device tap geometry feature describes the geometrical properties characterizing the taps of a Camera Link camera as seen from the frame grabber or acquisition card. Note the case of RGB where even though there are 3 color components, they are considered to be one tap (for instance, Camera Link specification defines 24-bit RGB as a single tap of 24 bits). This feature is mainly applicable to Camera link cameras.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the feature User Set to load, save or configure.

EnumEntry.Name: Default
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the factory setting User set.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the factory setting User set.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the first user set.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the first user set.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Selects the second user set.
EnumEntry.Description: Selects the second user set.

Command.Name: UserSetLoad
Command.ToolTip: Loads the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the device and makes it active.
Command.Description: Loads the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the device and makes it active.

Command.Name: UserSetSave
Command.ToolTip: Save the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the non-volatile memory of the device.
Command.Description: Save the User Set specified by UserSetSelector to the non-volatile memory of the device.

Enumeration.Name: UserSetDefaultSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the feature User Set to load and make active when the device is reset.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the feature User Set to load and make active when the device is reset.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Select the first User Set.
EnumEntry.Description: Select the first User Set.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Select the second User Set.
EnumEntry.Description: Select the second User Set.

Enumeration.Name: FileSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the target file in the device.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the target file in the device.

EnumEntry.Name: UserSetDefault
EnumEntry.ToolTip: the default user set of the device
EnumEntry.Description: the default user set of the device

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet1
EnumEntry.ToolTip: the first user set of the device
EnumEntry.Description: the first user set of the device

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet2
EnumEntry.ToolTip: the second user set of the device
EnumEntry.Description: the second user set of the device

EnumEntry.Name: UserSet3
EnumEntry.ToolTip: the third user set of the device
EnumEntry.Description: the third user set of the device

EnumEntry.Name: LUTLuminance
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Luminance LUT of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: The Luminance LUT of the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: LUTRed
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Red LUT of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: The Red LUT of the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: LUTGreen
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Green LUT of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: The Green LUT of the camera.

EnumEntry.Name: LUTBlue
EnumEntry.ToolTip: The Blue LUT of the camera.
EnumEntry.Description: The Blue LUT of the camera.

Enumeration.Name: FileOperationSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the target operation for the selected file in the device.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the target operation for the selected file in the device. This Operation is executed when the FileOperationExecute feature is called.

EnumEntry.Name: Open
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Opens the file selected by FileSelector in the device. The access mode in which the file is opened is selected by FileOpenMode
EnumEntry.Description: Opens the file selected by FileSelector in the device. The access mode in which the file is opened is selected by FileOpenMode

EnumEntry.Name: Close
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Closes the file selected by FileSelector in the device.
EnumEntry.Description: Closes the file selected by FileSelector in the device.

EnumEntry.Name: Read
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Reads FileAccessLength bytes from the device storage at the file relative offset FileAccessOffset into FileAccessBuffer.
EnumEntry.Description: Reads FileAccessLength bytes from the device storage at the file relative offset FileAccessOffset into FileAccessBuffer.

EnumEntry.Name: Write
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Writes FileAccessLength bytes taken from the FileAccessBuffer into the device storage at the file relative offset FileAccessOffset.
EnumEntry.Description: Writes FileAccessLength bytes taken from the FileAccessBuffer into the device storage at the file relative offset FileAccessOffset.

Command.Name: FileOperationExecute
Command.ToolTip: Executes the operation selected by FileOperationSelector on the selected file.
Command.Description: Executes the operation selected by FileOperationSelector on the selected file.

Enumeration.Name: FileOpenMode
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the access mode in which a file is opened in the device.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the access mode in which a file is opened in the device.

EnumEntry.Name: Read
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode selects read-only open mode.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode selects read-only open mode.

EnumEntry.Name: Write
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode selects write-only open mode.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode selects write-only open mode.

EnumEntry.Name: ReadWrite
EnumEntry.ToolTip: This mode selects read and write open mode.
EnumEntry.Description: This mode selects read and write open mode.

Register.Name: FileAccessBuffer
Register.ToolTip: Defines the intermediate access buffer that allows the exchange of data between the device file storage and the application.
Register.Description: Defines the intermediate access buffer that allows the exchange of data between the device file storage and the application.

Integer.Name: FileAccessOffset
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the Offset of the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.
Integer.Description: Controls the Offset of the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.

Integer.Name: FileAccessLength
Integer.ToolTip: Controls the Length of the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.
Integer.Description: Controls the Length of the mapping between the device file storage and the FileAccessBuffer.

Enumeration.Name: FileOperationStatus
Enumeration.ToolTip: Represents the file operation execution status.
Enumeration.Description: Represents the file operation execution status.

Integer.Name: FileOperationResult
Integer.ToolTip: Represents the file operation result.
Integer.Description: Represents the file operation result. For Read or Write operations, the number of successfully read/written bytes is returned.

Integer.Name: FileSize
Integer.ToolTip: Represents the size of the selected file in bytes.
Integer.Description: Represents the size of the selected file in bytes.

Enumeration.Name: ColorTransformationSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects which Color Transformation module is controlled by the various Color Transformation features.
Enumeration.Description: Selects which Color Transformation module is controlled by the various Color Transformation features.

Boolean.Name: ColorTransformationEnable
Boolean.ToolTip: Activates the selected Color Transformation module.
Boolean.Description: Activates the selected Color Transformation module.

Enumeration.Name: ColorTransformationValueSelector
Enumeration.ToolTip: Selects the Gain factor or Offset of the Transformation matrix to access in the selected Color Transformation module.
Enumeration.Description: Selects the Gain factor or Offset of the Transformation matrix to access in the selected Color Transformation module.

Float.Name: ColorTransformationValue
Float.ToolTip: Represents the value of the selected Gain factor or Offset inside the Transformation matrix.
Float.Description: Represents the value of the selected Gain factor or Offset inside the Transformation matrix.

Integer.Name: ActionDeviceKey
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the device key that allows the device to check the validity of action commands.
Integer.Description: Provides the device key that allows the device to check the validity of action commands. The device internal assertion of an action signal is only authorized if the ActionDeviceKey and the action device key value in the protocol message are equal.

Integer.Name: ActionSelector
Integer.ToolTip: Selects to which Action Signal further Action settings apply.
Integer.Description: Selects to which Action Signal further Action settings apply.

Integer.Name: ActionGroupMask
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the mask that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.
Integer.Description: Provides the mask that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.

Integer.Name: ActionGroupKey
Integer.ToolTip: Provides the key that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.
Integer.Description: Provides the key that the device will use to validate the action on reception of the action protocol message.
